doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
creation: 1797; alteration: circa 1805; alteration: 1930s; alteration: 1950; alteration: 1977
German Adelph Russow Home 1873-80. He won prize in Paris for wine from vineyards 1880--Dr Frederick T Holmes (William Newton Hale's Brother-in-Law) Home 1930s

Brick I-House, 2 Column Portico, 5 Bay, 4 Course American Bond, Flemish Bond, Queens Closers, Penciled, Greek Fret Moldings, Pitsaw Marks, Mortise and Tenon Pegged Joinery, Roman Numerals, Cut Nails with Stamped Heads, No Ridge Boards, Transom, 6 Panel Doors, Fanlight, Rubbed Gauged Brick Jack Arches, 6/6, 9/9, Splayed Windows, Blinds, Barred Cellar Windows, Slave Quarters, Corncrib, Barn, Well, Gardens, Vineyard, Slave Cemetery
Milton Grigg, Architect 1930s--William Newton Hale, Architect 1950--Don Swofford, Architect 1977 addition
survey data: Architecture in Virginia%Virginia Landmarks Register
Red Hills¶still image¶1797/1977¶Grigg, Milton L. (Milton LaTour), 1905-1982
